Reviews.Title: “Second visit”
Reviews.Author: Hildebart
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to this hotel. (See the review from my first visit: “Excellent location”). The room I got was much better than last time. Still first floor, but facing the backyard and not the noisy road. Nice and quiet room. Clean. Comfortable bed. As I was visiting in November, the loss of air condition wasn't a problem. This room had a bathtub and a safe as announced.

Reviews.Title: “Only location”
Reviews.Author: khuzu
Reviews.Content: If the location is the only thing matters to you, you can stay. But I would never use it again. There are lots of other hotels around.

Reviews.Title: “Vælg for beliggenhed, ikke for kvaltiteten!”
Reviews.Author: LNM_Cph
Reviews.Content: Nice bathroom with tub, but the room was not as nice. Very worn down furniture and quite uncomfortable beds (not at all as nice as on the official photos!). However, the location is very good: Right next to Kurfürstendamm, Zoo, KaDeWe,etc. We didn't try the breakfast at the hotel but I will strongly recommend the fabulous breakfast just around the cornor at Berliner Kaffeerösterei, Uhlandstraße 173/174. Delicious!! The public transportation is great and you can very easily go to other areas of town. I highly recomment that you buy a Berliner Karte (tourist transportation ticket - you choose how many days you want to pay for). You can use it to/from the airport and for u-bahn, s-bahn and busses in the city. Worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Azimuth Kurfuerstendamm”
Reviews.Author: Chris P
Reviews.Content: A bit grubby on arrival and had to wait until past 14.00 to get a room. Although the hotel has a bar, it wasn't manned, and the receptionist could only provide a basic bar service, (no hot drinks). Room was clean and adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Depends on the price per night”
Reviews.Author: one1bg
Reviews.Content: LOCATION-Excellent : + / 5-10 min walk to Zoologischer Garten s-bahn and bus station , 3-5 min to Kurfürstendamm‎ U-bahn station . ATRACTIONS : + /Kaiser-Wilhelm-Gedächtniskirche ZOO ,Aquarium Berlin ,Torre Flak Kurfürstendamm‎- The Biggest shopping Street in Berlin Many Resturants and Bars +++SAFETY+++: The neighborhood is excellent, much better than Alexander platz which is full of beggars and purse thieves. ---------------------------------------------The HOTEL ------------------------------------------------------ Most of the hotel rooms which are at a good price - 70-120 EURO are not repaired like in the pictures . - Тhe hotel refurbished several new rooms, but they are much more expensive than others and I'm not sure it's worth taking them !!!- DONT TAKE ROOM IN FIRST FLOOR -In the end of the corridor are the lifts and restaurant and have a constant noise************!!!!!! The rooms are clean and normal-size.And the bathroom is a normal size The furniture is old but well maintained.The bed was comfortable. !!!ATTENTION!!! If you go during the summer the hotel IS without air conditioning . STAFF-speak quite BAD ENGLISH and are NOT client oriented. ***I think the hotel is only worth if you take the room up to 60-70Euro per night ++++++++IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR THE SAFETY AND NICE HOTEL LOCATION+++++++ : Kurfürstendamm‎, Tiergarten , Potsdamer platz , Check Point Charlie , Friedrichstraße, Brandenburger Tor‎, Under den LInden. Thank you for your attention and Pleasant stay in Berlin ........

Reviews.Title: “Ich have bin ein Berliner”
Reviews.Author: jamesdoc16
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in a busy shopping area, this hotel is comfortable, clean and good value and I would strongly recommend it. The double glazing blocks out most street noise. Breakfast is excellent; don't miss the scrambled eggs and "speck" (bacon!). About 10 minutes away near Platz Sevigny there are several nice little bars (try the Mommsen-Eck).

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: boxerteeth
Reviews.Content: The Azimut is located in Central Berlin close to the best shops good restaurants and bars.The rooms are large and not badly furnished.Beds are comfortable.Breakfast is Buffet style and there is a good choice.Staff are friendly and helpfull.Overall a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Azimut is the place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: FriedaLloyd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in Berlin and so accessible from Tegel Airport! The staff are professional and helpful and it is very easy to make your way to the local sights and shops. Internet is free. If ever I had to return to Berlin I will most definitely stay at Azimut again.

Reviews.Title: “Good points marred by a bad bed”
Reviews.Author: EeroE
Reviews.Content: The Azimut Kurfurstendamm is located just right, the building is pleasantly old-fashioned (nothing for handicapped with all the stairs) and the breakfast is fine. All that was marred by the beds in our room (small but quiet, towards the inner court) being uncomfortable and creaky. Nothing disturbs a good night's sleep that loud creaks everytime you turn! We stayed only three nights and did not bother to complain as we did not fancy to move rooms after unpacking, with no guarantee that the other beds would be better. It seemd to be a bed-structure related problem. Besides, the staff was very friendly and helpful, so we let it go ...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Xela1
Reviews.Content: Great location with public transportation to all the places in the city. Rooms are spacious and recently renovated. In our week just replaced televisions to LCD. We really enjoyed the breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Find!”
Reviews.Author: PatrolNH
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by walking past it one day. My husband was in the hospital (he became ill during our stay in Berlin) and I needed an inexpensive place to stay. I looked it up and booked it for 3 nights, not knowing what to expect. It's a beautiful old world hotel right near the Ku'damm & Zoo Station. The rooms are big (by European standards), the bathroom is fantastic, mini fridge in the room, door opens out to balcony. We ended up staying 3 extra nights until we were able to fly back home. They have free Wi-Fi but breakfast is an extra charge. Right around the corner is a grocery store where you can buy all you need. Definitely would recommend and stay here again, if I have the chance!

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Patricia M
Reviews.Content: Ideal position for sightseeing, shopping and plenty places to eat. The hotel staff were excellent and breakfast staff attentive although I found it strange there were no lids for the teapots. However, the varietyof food on offer at breakfast was excellent. We stayed in room 308, large room with wall to ceiling windows excellent views. However the decorations looked dated and tired and only CNN available on the TV..Saying that we were out most oif the day and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location in the West.”
Reviews.Author: Glenofthedowns123
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a City Break. In the West Side, which is not the origional city centre, it has only developed since the Berlin Wall. This city centre does not have the character of the East, but is close to all main shops and transport systems. Bedrooms are fine, nothing exceptional. Breakfast, good selection of everything.

Reviews.Title: “A good sound choice”
Reviews.Author: Ilolahti
Reviews.Content: This has become our regular home when in Berlin - for marathon or otherwise. Good location, in city centre and close to Tiergarten. Nice breakfast, although crowded. Service has improved over the years. In fact there's only one "soviet type" left. Last time we were happily surprised in receiving a luxury type room. Very big and beautiful. 'Thanks to our regular visits in the hotel', they said. Well, that is something I really appreciate! - A view to Gedächtniskirche from the bath. And best hotel WLAN ever - for free. But one dubious flaw. Water mixer in tabs of the bathroom did not work. At first they only gave very hot or extremely hot water. By switching on and off it finally worked. But it could be dangerous. We did mention the matter to the reception. Nevertheless this hotel is worth more than 3 stars. See you again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerseyjoenorthernNJ
Reviews.Content: Very good location within block or two underground, airport buses and railroad station. Older hotel but in very good condition. Room was very clean with a small but functional bathroom. Located on busy corner so ask for a court side room. Ours had 12 foot ceilings, new windows and was quite. Chis, the day manager was charming, funny and very helpful. Like most Berlin hotels, no A/C, but the in room free wifi was speedy and always worked.If you go in summer ask to borrow a fan. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Niklas P
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends went on a little trip to Berlin for a weekend and stayed att Azimut Ku'dam. We stayed in rooms 102 and 103. Excellent location near both U and S bahn. The staff was friendly and helpfull with excellent knowledge of Berlin and surroundings. The rooms had good standard and were cleaned properly. The only problem we had was that they didn't have any "Hotel parking" for the car, so we had to park the car 200m away. Next time we'll fly there instead. I Have plans on going to Berlin this fall again and will book room(s) on Azimut again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for its money”
Reviews.Author: barrancas1
Reviews.Content: Located directly on the Ku'damm, near U/S-bahn stations, shops, sightseens etc. Room was very very simple but clean. Well idea to stay if you just sleep in the hotel. Uncomfortable moments: too noicy, both from the street and from neighbouring rooms. And also they have problem with airconditioning - all smells from kitchen goes to corridor and rooms in this side of building. And it was very strong smells. Every morning I waked up with only one thought that now I hate scrambled eggs and pancakes....

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not so great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KristinCro
Reviews.Content: Just visited Berlin for the first time with a friend. We booked this hotel because it was inexpensive and had fairly good reviews and had free wi-fi. Overall it was just OK especially since we were only looking for a place to lay our heads at night. The room was small, and the bathroom even smaller! However both were clean and tidy so i can't really complain. The mattresses felt a bit worn and squeaky and there was only about one foot of space between the two beds, we might as well have booked a room with one big bed! Only one pillow on each bed and we never bothered to call down and ask for another assuming they would make us come down and get it ourselves. I say this, because when we checked in to a far from warm welcome no one told us about the wi-fi. So we made it up to our room and tried to open there free wi-fi but as you would expect you need a password. So we called down to the front desk to ask for the password and they told us we had to come down and retrive it from the front desk. Would have been nice to know that at the time of check in! On a positive note, Berlin is so easy to manuever via public transit and there are U & S bhan stops just steps away from the front door of the hotel. It is also situated in a nice shopping district and close to the zoo and aquarium.

Reviews.Title: “Old but enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: timjackson6
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 day stay at the Azimut, this is the first time back to Berlin since being stationed there from 89/94. We wanted somewhere that was freindly but lived in and the Azimut was all that. The only downside is no air con in the rooms, but that said you can get a fan from reception. The duty managers were very helpful, especially Chris, who I had a lot of banter with over english football teams. Anyway the long and short of it, well worth staying there, close enough for all you people who love to shop, good bars and 5 min from the main bus/train station. There may be better Hotels within the area of the Azimut but I would definatley stay there again Getting there from Tegel airport just get the bus X9 into the Zoologischer Garten‎ and its 5min walk to the hotel head for the Ku'Damm. Taxi 20 euros Bus 2.30 euros takes about 20min depending on traffic. Be freindly and people will be freindly back. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AlainMayni
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Azimut for 4 nights. In few words; - It's located in a shopping area and next to metro and bus stations, and it's calm at night. - The rooms could be better but they justify the value. - The staff is extremely helpful I haven't tried other hotels in Berlin to compare, but overall I had a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: sa_uk_traveller
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money! We paid approx. £45 per night and probably didn't get one of the best rooms - but it was still more than adequate for a short stay. No view, but we were only at the hotel to sleep anyway. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel (£12.50) but waking up to the smell of bacon made me wish we had... Everything was very clean - including linen and bathroom. The bathroom was very small but perfectly fine for a short stay. Good shower! Good location - very close to Zoo station, which has bus links, and U and S bahn links. Buses X9 and 109 from Tegel airport stop right outside. Approx. 30-45min.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big rooms”
Reviews.Author: PrivateEyes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a great location, seconds away from the Ku'dam, the main shopping street and also seconds away from one of the bigger train stations in Berlin. It has two parts to it, the new part and the old part. I had read a review from one traveller to ask for a room in the new part and thats what i did. It was a spacious, clean room with a spotless and modern bathroom. The only drawback to this hotel was that in my 3 days stay there, the sheets were not cleaned. I know this because i was wearing some fake tan, noticed it had left a mark the next morning and it remained on the sheets for our whole stay. I didnt complain to anyone because it would not bother me too much but you do expect clean sheets from a hotel every day. Other than that, I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - otherwise blah”
Reviews.Author: pinkilili
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Azimut with my husband for a long weekend in Berlin. The hotel's location is great, near a metro station and a short walk away from shops and restaurants. Other than that, it's not so great. The breakfast was good enough and the breakfast room nice and airy. But our room was like from another time!! The furniture was old and looked worn out. The walls were paper thin. The bathroom was tiny. And the worst thing was that every morning I woke up to the smell of someone in the kitchen cooking eggs. I absolutely hate the smell of eggs and this was a really strong, greasy smell which was impossible to escape. I guess they should do something about the ventilation in this hotel. I understood that this hotel has an old and new side, so if you do stay here, I suggest that you ask to be located in the newer rooms. Berlin is a great city and there's lots to see and do, but if going for a romantic weekend, then it would be recommended to choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you like shopping - its a great place to base yourself from”
Reviews.Author: jezvee
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for a week at the hotel and initially my first impressions were not good. I was given a corner room (no 252) which really you couldnt swing a cat in. It was tiny and was extremely uncomfortable. However, after a few days of trying to make it work i did finally sum the courage up to ask for a change of room especially considering what i had paid for it and i am happy to say my new room was far better. large and spacious and great internet connectivity. The bathrooms are small but thats ok as long as the room is like what i had. The hotels passage ways are really interesting and make for a historical walk when heading down for breakfast. breakfast was simple but had all that you would want and there is this great italian restaurant litteraly on the doorstep and the food there is brilliant. you are very close to the big shopping areas like C&A, Karstady and KedeWe which for someone like me - a shopoholic was ideal. East access to taxis and the train and great restaurants within walking distance. The bar though is not great so you tend to stay out, eat out, drink out and then just come back to the hotel to sleep which can be frustrating when after a days work you actually want to just have a couple of drinks at the bar and go to bed but it serves the need and with the room change it ended up a better stay than when i started so just watch out for those cheap and nasty corner rooms - they really are bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beth011
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Azimut hotel for 3 nights in Oct , great location , great transport just outside hotel, nice area with restaurants ,shops and a nice Irish pub just down the street. The hotel was clean and quiet we had a room to the back so very little noise, the staff were pleasent and helpful when ever we asked for directions, would stay here again, and Berlin a great city, took the bus tour which was good and gave you a feel for where attractions are, over all a great week-end.

Reviews.Title: “Do you like shopping? Welcome to Azimut (Belmondo) :)”
Reviews.Author: Elena_B_2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and found it as an ideal base for exploring city and, of course, for shopping, especially when there are sales :). S-Bahn and U-Bahn stations are very close, as well as stop of the bus to/from Tegel airport and regular buses or routes № 100&200 which can be used for sightseeing. Our room was big, with high ceilings. There can be a problem when it's hot - due to absence of air-conditioning. It was noisy to sleep when windows facing the street were open. The shower curtain was not fixed properly - due to this the carpet at the entrance to the bath was constantly wet.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and free wi-fi!!”
Reviews.Author: decosp
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel because I wanted somewhere near Zoo Station as I was travelling to/from Tegel and the bus departs/arrives from there. Got a very good deal at expedia.... only £27per night for a single room. Room was ok nothing special, clean, shower was good and the free wi-fi was a plus. There are plenty of better hotels in Berlin but for the price was a good deal and would have no problems staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in central Berlin”
Reviews.Author: 25YearsAbroad
Reviews.Content: Berlin was just a stopover on this trip. We arrived very early in the morning after travelling all night and were flying out again at 2am. So we didn't even stay a full day and we were looking for somewhere very reasonable to base ourselves in central Berlin, store our luggage and have a rest and shower before taking off again. Firstly we were impressed that the hotel let us check in so very early in the morning without a question. The staff were very friendly. We did have a lot of luggage and there are steps off the street up to the lobby and again up to our room which may not be suitable for everyone. The entry steps and lobby are very impressive in this beautiful old building: Marble pillars, frescoed scenes on walls, plush carpets, big wooden banister with a large sculpted lions head. Really lovely entrance. The room was old but freshly painted and spotless. Linens were crisp and white and beds were comfortable which we needed for our afternoon nap and bathroom was very nice for the price paid. I remember enjoying the view from the window which looked out on the big intersection below. We were especially pleased with the location. We caught the train in from the Schoenfield airport (I think it's called) and caught the train right to Zoo station which was kitty corner to the hotel which was extremely convenient with all our luggage. We found a great little bakery/coffee shop around the corner and a really great restaurant just across the street for dinner. Berlin seemed so reasonable after Paris. We walked to the bombed out church up the street, and then through the big park up the long avenue to the Brandenburg Gate and Russian memorial and continued walking around to Checkpoint Charlie and other sights and then back to the hotel. The hotel is on one of the main shopping streets in the city and very convenient to many sights and to public transport so we were extremely happy with our choice considering our time was so short and we didn't want to spend all day on buses as we had a flight that night. The staff were a bit shocked when we checked out at midnight and seemed to feel bad that we were going to miss breakfast and even a sleep. but we assured them it was fine and just what we needed and we got such a good price online that we certainly were pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Joonatan2003
Reviews.Content: The great advantage of the hotel is its location. It is the heart of the Kudam area and it is very easy to reach any part of Berlin thanks to public transport close to the hotel. The area around Hotel Belmondo is also very pleasant with a lot of shops, bars, restaurants and stuff to visit like KaiserWilhem kirche, the Zoo... Erotic Museum! :) The decoration of the hotel is quite kitsch & outdated. The rooms are quite basic & it is can be really hot inside! I even do not imagine in summer time! It is basically clean. The staff was helpful, professional. I especially appreciated the special alarm clock hotel around 7am. It consisted in sausage smell invading the entire room!!! Pretty weird indeed!? Anyway, if you want to visit Berlin, my wife & I would recommend this place & the price is OK! :)

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Maureen066
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in the Belmondo, lovely old style hotel ,efficient check in and out. Staff very friendly, hotel spotless , room very comfortable, towels changed every day,lovely breakfast, selection of meats and cheeses, boiled and scrambled eggs, fruits, yogurts. Very central, mins from buses and trai. Not suitable for people with mobility problems as there are quite a few steps from street level to the first floor where the reception is located.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Silver_Greece
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel at March for 3 nights during a short trip to Berlin. The hotel is at west side, but it's really central with many places to go around it. The hotel was clean, rooms were quite spacious, the breakfast was delicious! Staff was helpful and generally we enjoyed our stay. But the best thing was that the hotel was only few steps far from two U-bahn station, from S-bahn (Zoo) and a bus station. Neighboorhood was very safe and even late at night we didn't have any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good value for money, tiny room, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ViaggiaBene
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Belmondo for 2 nights in mid march. The hotel is nice and quite large, it is good value for money (with the exception of breakfast that is really overpriced) Friendly and helpful staff, I had a very small room overlooking the Ku'damm so it was a bit noisy at night but overall ok. The building is a bit of a labyrinth and the lift is far from reception - be prepared to walk up the stairs and along long corridors to get anywhere Hotel location is convenient , in the main shopping area of Berlin and near some of the main tourist attractions but it is also near the dodgy Bahnhof Zoo area (sex shops & peep shows - but safe)

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hotel I've ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: Jerda81
Reviews.Content: Booking to this Hotel has been a real waste of money! I paid for a Deluxe room, reserved 4 months before my trip. They gave us a room absolutely uncomfortable,, less than 10mq, in the basement, near to the trash. When I complained, the director said that room was a "Deluxe" as I booked for. Now I can't imagine a standard room... really really bad! The staff is unfriendly: we were rejected from breakfast room at 9:45 because the room has to be closed at 10:00. Incredible! Please save yourself and NEVER BOOK TO THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “My shoes got stolen!”
Reviews.Author: BabyAlice
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible, bad service bad everything... My shoes were stolen and when I reported this to the hotel staff I was met with a shrug and it was basically implied that I was trying to con them out of something. To quote a very famous Australian saying, Not Happy Jan! I would never stay here again nor would I recommend it to anyone else. It was very disappointing that the travel agent sold it as a 4 star hotel when clearly it does not even rate being 1 star. A harsh review maybe, but trust me, extremely fair.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Vladislav1
Reviews.Content: Now we are second day in this hotel. First of all, that hotel is locating on the very busy and noisy road which is never sleeps. Room is quite dirty and very, very smoked. To open a windows is umpossible because of smoke and noise from the road. (We had requested non-smoking room). Today evening we came to our room and the door to the room was opened. Probably cleaning staff forget to close it, we informed a reception, they told us sorry... Unfrendly staff is an attachement to finalize a picture. We are still here, we have to pass over two nights more. If somebody would give us questions please contact. We will describe you everithing in colors with great pleasure. Contact: [--]

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sisteranne
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Berlin on a Saturday morning , went to our hotel and were told that there were no reservations for us ! After phoning our travel agent back home , we were told to come to the Belmondo - I am glad we did ! It is a lovely , clean hotel.The staff were very friendly and efficient . Our room was a good size - only down side I would say was that there were no tea/coffee making facilities , and there was no air conditioning. Very handy location for transport - the train system is second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Well located bargain hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marsupial23
Reviews.Content: Very easy to get to from the airport. Bus stops right out front. No lift at the entrance, stairs to reception. First room they gave us was tiny, it had one single bed and one foldup bed that looked like a child's bed. We had ordered a double room so spoke to the front desk and were then moved to a much larger room with a king size bed. Air conditioning didnt appear to work, so rooms a bit stuffy. Lovely breeze through the windows but very noisy with them open. Small bathroom. Breakfast not included, found a lovely place around the corner called "Marche" which was much better and cheaper than the hotel's breakfast. Close to transport, and all attractions. Good budget hotel, but I would imagine it would be very hot in the height of summer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but try to avoid the hot season”
Reviews.Author: RTM1510
Reviews.Content: This hotel would be great if it was <70 outside. Amenities were fine and hotel was well accoutured and located very close to the U-Bahn...wonderful location and well priced, but dangit all, if it's hot outside you're pretty much hosed. OTHERWISE - great property.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel - good value for money - retro design.”
Reviews.Author: htimsrh
Reviews.Content: Loved the location although it was a bit nosiy at times due to the location being on the main street. Brilliant location for the Berlin trains which are so efficient. Hotel's bed slates were broken on arrival however these were promptly fixed. Free bottle of wine on arrival was a nice bonus. The hotel is slightly dated but has a retro feel which i liked. The staff were polite and friendly and made us feel at home. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well said, Pete”
Reviews.Author: rich.hull
Reviews.Content: These comments will be very much like Pete's review below - we too got this on a deal, which gave us a free night, and paid about the same. True, the flight of stairs up to reception will be a bind if you're loaded with luggage, but after that its ok. Thee IS a lift, from reception upwards. Everything fro here on was plain sailing. Large, comfortable room, appeared recently decorated, with good quality fixtures and fittings (number 353).If I'd had a big enough suitcase, I'd have nicked the wardrobe. Now personally, I don't mind a bit of street noise, but if you don't, this room overlooks a quiet courtyard. Breakfast was fine, regularly topped up, and we had no problems getting a table each morning. There's also a pleasant, old fashioned bar, with pleasant, old fashioned leather armchairs and a pleasant, old fashioned barman. Prices no dearer than most bars. Location, as others have said, is difficult to beat - 5mins walk from Zoo station, 2mins walk from Kudamm u-bahn. Staff for the most part were very friendly and polite, and quite happy to put up with my German skills. Impressed by - DDR Museum, complete with virtual reality Trabbie ride. Christmas Markets - the whole town seems lit up. KaDeWe - got lost in the food court. Brauhaus Lemke - in railway arch at Hackesche Markt. Strangly relaxing to be having a pint whilst trains thunder overhead.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel.”
Reviews.Author: avecarvalho
Reviews.Content: I was going to stay at Boulevard hotel, but they overbooked me!! They managed to find a room in Hotel Belmondo, half a block away from Boulevard hotel. Its is an old hotel that has been renewed some years ago. Its spacial configuration is a little bit weird and take a lot of walk to get to some of the rooms, in particular those in the right wing (worse if you have lots of luggage). The staff is just professional, not friendly. My room was more like a pod, extremely small (beware, all the rooms located on corners tend to be that small). Everything seemed a little improvised and the noise from the street (Ku'damm) was very loud. It was clean, though. The positive thing about the hotel is it`s location, near Zoo Hauptbahnhof and the best shopping area in Berlin. And it has free wi-fi internet connection on the lobby too.

Reviews.Title: “How did they get the extra star?”
Reviews.Author: KiwiJenLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel when my husband was running the Berlin marathon. We had previously stayed here about 3 years previous in it's former incarnation as the Comfort Fruhling. It was a 2 star hotel then so not overly disappointing - at least we knew what to expect! The 'refurbished' Belmondo is now a 3 star, but I really can't see why they were re-graded. The entrance and lobby of the hotel is fine, although the tacky plastic chandeliers let it down, however I'm fairly certain that our room was in the same state as our previous trip - the stains on the carpet looked that old at least. Our room size was good, with nice high ceilings and windows that faced out onto the K'damm. It's a shame that there is no aircon, as to have the windows open to get some air means it becomes very, very noisy. The bathroom is tiny, although the shower pressure was fine. The worst part for me was the bed - two iron frame singles pushed tgether. I don't mind that, however when one bed is approx 15 cm higher than the other it becomes something of a joke. Breakfast was fine, but it's not hard to get a continental buffet right. Staff were mostly ok, however when we asked for an iron and an ironing board (these are not supplied in each room), they were able to provide the iron but no board. My husband ended up pressing his shirt on a towel on the floor, and 30 mins later we had a call from the front desk stating that they 'had lost the ironing board'. This was our third trip to the city, we love Berlin, but do yourself a favour and stay elsewhere (The Alsterhof is good).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: shell_81_au
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, surrunded by great shopping, nice restaurants and bars and walking distance to 2 train stations and a bus terminal. The rooms are large, but ours had no airconditioning and although it was not very hot, the rooms were stuffy and necessitated opening the windows which unfortunately led to a loss of sleep since the hotel is on a very busy road. Expedia had this hotel room at a 3 star property, I'd say its more like a 2. If you are looking for an inexpensive hotel in a good location, this is the place for you. If you are looking for a comfortable stay in a well adorned room, this place is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but average hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1globetrotterSweden
Reviews.Content: Great location but nothing else than average. Looks better from the outside than it really is. Small rooms and it can be a very long way to the room fro the reception. The hotel is big! I was not satisfied with tha fact that I couldn't have my room until 15.00 even if I were there 12.00. The room was ready and just waiting! Close to Bahnhof Zoo tough.

Reviews.Title: “location is the only good thing it's got going for it”
Reviews.Author: trevostar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in Berlin, I'm sure every single other review will rave about the location. However, that's really the best aspect of staying here. If you are planning to stay here, one very important fact about this place is that THERE IS NO LIFT. So if you have heavy luggage then this is going to be problem, not even after you check in, but starting from before you even enter the front door. The front door is already up quite a few stairs, we had very heavy luggage and boxes as we were there for many days and had to bring work materials for the exhibition. Don't expect any help with your luggage as there is usually just one staff behind the desk and no one at the door. After we entered the front door there were more steps you have to take to get to check-in. The one staff that was there and was not occupied with anyone didn't feel the urge to help us eventhough we were going back and forth to get our things and drag them up the stairs to the check-in desk. We arrived at 6am and had booked rooms for the night before so that we would not have to wait until 2pm to be able to go in to the room and shower after our long flight. First thing the check-in staff did after seeing our names was tell us off for not checking in the day before or informing them. I explained to them that we meant to do that, that it was intentional, as we needed to check in at 6am so we were happy to pay one whole night for a few hours. She still thought it was ok to tell us off like we had done something wrong, that they could still sell those rooms had we informed them we would not be using them the night before we landed. I mean, why is she having a problem with this??? We paid for those rooms and we can use them or not use them as we please!! We weren't trying to avoid paying for that night or anything. We were completely aware of what we were trying to do. And if she was trying to sell those rooms that we had paid for and get double the amount by sneaking in an early leaver or something... well then that's pure dodgy. The room itself was ok but not great. Bathroom is literally 2 by 2 metres, so it's a tight squeeze. Only bathroom amenity was the soap/shampoo combo that is fixed on the wall. Shower cubicle could not keep the water in there so if you don't want to flood your room don't shower for too long. TV is about 12 inches max, might even be smaller. Pillow was was weird, was shaped kinda like a donut from the bottom up and was really uncomfortable. Also, you can get very well acquainted with the friendly neighbours here as I even heard the people next door doing it one night, quite loudly and clearly, just as I was getting to ready to go to bed. No internet available in the hotel, the only way is to use wi-fi and pick up T-Mobile's hotspot signals, which you can pay for, but it's very expensive. I do go to Berlin every year and will not be returning to Hardenberg again. Last year at Hotel California just down the road was much better, especially given that they were the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: WelshWizards
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel between the 26-29/11/06. It is in an ideal location for sight seeing and public transport. I would highly recommend the walking tours which meet out side the Zoogolisher Garten station. The hotel was clean, warm and the staff were friendly. Breakfast was a bit basic but adequate. No bar on the premises. For what it cost, it was an ideal base. There are loads of shops and restaurants within a 5 minute walk. Checkpoint Charlie was a disappointment, they torn it all down and all thats left is a series of hoardings which tell the story. christmas markets were there and worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fantastic Breakfast, Big Rooms, Friendy Staff”
Reviews.Author: Andrew005
Reviews.Content: Well I booked this Hotel over 13 months before we stayed, as they accepted a booking for the dates for the World Cup which we had been notified that we had back in May 2005. It was purely down to the fact they would accept the booking so far in advance and that they did not hike up the price for the World Cup. Location is perfect, right next to Zoo station, which is a hub for the main public transport system in Berlin. Buses 109 or X9 get you straight there from the airport for 2.10euro each and 1.40 for children. The journey takes 15 to 20 minutes. The Hotel is only 2 or 3 minutes from Zoo Station and as it's the last stop for the 109 or X9 you can't fail! Check in was quick and staff excellent, even gave my 6-year-old son a World Cup Teddy Bear! Staircase and lobby very impressive! Our room was on the 2nd floor and each room has the advantage of being down a locked corridor coming off the main staircase - this gives additional security as that means you have to use two keys, one to get into the corridor and one to get to your room. Rooms were large and beds big and comfortable. Bathroom large and like the room everything very clean and well maintained. TV had 46 channels including CNN and BBC World. Breakfast was really excellent. I've stayed is many many hotels much more expensive than this one, but this breakfast was superb. Service from the staff was excellent in the breakfast restaurant too. Location for shopping could not be better as the main shopping street in Berlin only 1 minute walk away. Check out the Karstadt Sport shop opposite, this has to be one of the biggest sports shops in the world! The Zoo is right across the street too and has 15,000 animals in there. The Restaurant on the top floor of the KA DE WE departement store on the main shopping street has some wonderful (and cheap) food and fantastic views across the city. All in all a wonderful hotel, fantastic location and can truly recommend you stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: McBlane
Reviews.Content: The only downside to this hotel is the lack of a lift. Otherwise it is great.The standard room was of a good size and simply furnished. The bathroom was rather small but nice.Both were modern in contrast with the rest of the hotel. The reception (1st floor), the staircase leading to it,and the breakfast room are from a different age.They are all magnificent.Breakfast was good with a wide choice and enhanced by the surroundings. The location is convenient for transport links. The airport bus 109 stops at the door and the express service X9 stops at the Zoo Bahnhof 200m. from the hotel. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for train (Local& International)”
Reviews.Author: antonyb
Reviews.Content: 200 yards from zoo station for trains & buses. Excellent helpful staff, lovely old building. Large room,clean, attractive dining room, good breakfast. Close to numerous restaurants. Quiet despite central, handy to city centre. Stairs but lovely staircases. Will stay again, ideal for Eurailers

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: ScottUK
Reviews.Content: A great disappointment after reading the previous reviews, the location is good but the cramped room was not worth the Euro140 rate a night. The shower cubicle leaked water all over the bathroom floor, the pillows were lumpy, constant traffic noise during the night, empty cola bottles on top of the wardrobe and a basic breakfast buffet which kept running out as not being replenished without reminders. On a positive note the staff were very friendly. Overall i would only recommend this hotel for half the rate I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Allwrighty2
Reviews.Content: The Hardenberg rooms are basic, but its location close to Zoo is ideal for getting around. The breakfast is a must and the variety of food offered in the breakfast room is amazing. The 109 bus from Tegel airport stops outside the hotel so the transfer from the airport to the hotel couldn't be easier. Rates are decent for a city centre hotel in such a prime location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: bluemar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June 2004. Wonderfully located with easy access to transportation (Zoo Station) and within walking distance to major attractions. The hotel is clean, quiet, and the room we had was large by european standards (vaulted ceiling and large marble bathroom). The staff was friendly and courteous. However, when venturing out for the day you must leave you room key at the front desk. Will definately return.

HotelInfo.Name: Azimut Hotel Berlin Kurfuerstendamm
HotelInfo.Address: Joachimstaler Str 39-40 | corner Kurfuerstendamm, 10623 Berlin, Germany
